I do get a whiff of it every so often throughout the day so I would say if you&#39;re sensitive to scents, this may be a bit strong for you, but I don&#39;t mind it. It may interfere with perfumes or body sprays but honestly I don&#39;t know because I don&#39;t really use them. Smells exactly like the perfume. I don&#39;t know how long this will last me but it&#39;s a little over half the size of a typical deodorant and it can take me up to a year to get through a deodorant so I&#39;m perfectly fine paying the price tag one or twice a year. I work in an office setting, and I&#39;m also a very active individual because I go to the gym 5-6 times a week.
When I do got the gym after work, I&#39;d have to reapply but then as soon as I sweat, I can smell myself again. Yes, some of you may be rolling your eyes and be thinking, &quot;Well duh, you just worked out of course you stink.&quot; No, there&#39;s a level of working out a sweat and not be smelly vs working out and smell bad.
I found this on Sephora&#39;s website and was able to locate it in store. $27 for a small bottle is pricey, but i was like what the heck, i&#39;ll give it a try. I purchased this on 7/15/17, and started using it the next day. It was a typical summer day, I did my usual routine because it was the weekend and went to the gym for 90 minutes. I came out, still smelling like clean, and I mean clean.
Just a few days, I already noticed a difference. I did see some other people&#39;s comment stating you shouldn&#39;t apply too much because the white powder, that is true. But I haven&#39;t had a hard time cleaning the product off my armpits.
If you are an individual like me, who can sweat easily and feel embarrassed about your armpit odor, I highly recommend you give this product a try.
4 star reason is just because the price. I wish they would do a travel size for this and price it at like $10. thought it was about time I wrote a review on this deodorant, since I&#39;ve been using it for a couple years. It&#39;s a really nice deodorant, that lasts a long time. One bottle lasts for about 4 months, for me. So, I think the value is great!
It&#39;s in a larger than usual container, with some weight to it. It&#39;s really, REALLY smooth. It&#39;s got somewhat of a silky-dry texture, that really keeps my armpits moisturized, with no wetness to it. With drugstore deodorants, I&#39;m always itching my underarms, for some reason. I never have that problem, with this formula. It keeps me dry for a good 24+ hours &amp; does well layered, if something happens where I can&#39;t take a shower (Mom Life..) lol!
The scent is not my favorite, as I wouldn&#39;t go out &amp; intentionally buy the Cashmere Mist perfume. But, it&#39;s rather nice for a deodorant. It starts out pretty strong &amp; definitely dies down. I don&#39;t know of another scent to really compare it to, except maybe do you remember that old drug store scent, I think it was Cody Mist or something like that.. It reminds me of that. Definitely an acquired scent. But, for some reason it&#39;s a great deodorant scent. Not light &amp; fresh, more woodsy &amp; what you&#39;d expect a scent called &quot;Cashmere&quot; to smell like. I know that&#39;s not too helpful, but I&#39;m trying. It&#39;s a powdery/woodsy scent.
It&#39;s got 0 wetness to it &amp; I have no problems of it transferring on to clothing that I&#39;ve ever noticed!
Lastly, my 2 teenageers would always steal this from me. Even my son is always on the hunt for my deodorant. He&#39;s a 16 year old basketball player, who&#39;s constantly training &amp; working out. I swear, he goes from one gym to another, all day long. This one is his favorite for keeping the smell/wetness at bay. Weird, I know. Just don&#39;t tell anyone, he&#39;d kill me! lol! My daughter, who&#39;s 18, swears by this as well. I accidently left this in a Sephora bag, she took to college, so I told her to keep it. She LOVES it! It&#39;s lasted her 4 months &amp; counting. She has hyperhidrosis &amp; had botox shots in her armpits about 8 months ago, which worked really well! She&#39;s suffered from this embarrassment for so long, it was time to do something about it. It didn&#39;t take away all wetness &amp; didn&#39;t take away the smell, so she still needs deodorant, so she&#39;s so happy she has this, even if it is by accident. I&#39;m not SO sure it was an accident, since when she was at home, she was always looking for mine. But, nevertheless, she LOVES it! She&#39;s told me several times.

I dont really care for the subtle baby powder scent as another reviewer mentioned, which is true it has but it is not overpowering. And I cover it when I need to, using eau de parfum. The solution this product provides is unique. it seems to be long-lasting, also. I live in Louisiana, and it gets VERY hot here, so I needed a reliable deodorant with all-day protection. This was DEFINITELY it. Initially, I hesitated a few weeks to buy it because of the price, but I eventually bought it. Best decision ever! The smell is lovely, soft and not overpowering, and I am protected/fresh ALL day long. I tried to get this type of success with Suave Clinical Strength, but it doesn&#39;t begin to compare to DK. If you&#39;re thinking of purchasing this, don&#39;t hesitate. It works wonders. The scent of this deodorant is overwhelming. I literally smelled it every time I inhaled for an entire day, and felt like my entire office could smell my deodorant. I had to wipe my underarm area with a paper towel, and then I was able to tolerate it. To me, this is no different than the $3 baby powder drug store deodorant. I do have a problem where at the end of the day I get a little smelly, and this deodorant did cover it up through the night, unfortunately it was with that horrible baby powered scent, so I ended up taking a shower just to wash it off. I am giving it away.<div class="m_1530283722721332937gmail-css-24xd2x"
